intro: Oncinotis nigra, commonly known as black nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Its leaves are ovate with a slightly hairy texture, and it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. Oncinotis nigra is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full shade.
